_header: Mary mother come and see / Thy son is nailed on a tree
Note: For an earlier version in couplets see 3326; for later stanzaic versions see 2029 and 5653, where this incipit serves as the burden.
Subjects: carols, of the Passion; Passion; dialogues, Virgin and Christ
_description: Song of the Passion — seven quatrains (aabb, aaaa) and burden: ‘Nowel el…’

BLSl2593.First Lines:
Mary moder cum & seThi sone is naylyd on a
                    tre…
BLSl2593.Last Lines:
…Ther is non wyght that goth be the wayOf myn peynys can wel
                    say

BLAdd31042.Transcription: mare moder cum & seþi nawne dere chyld ys nalyd on treboth fowt & hand he may not goþat blyssyd chyld ys lappyd in woþat blyssyd chy…
BLAdd31042.Note: Fragment only, written two lines of verse per line of manuscript; no burden; stanza 1 and first line, stanza 2, only.
